Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different types of habitats, one land habitat and one water habitat.
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or animals like lizards and fish.
The student can make observations and draw at least two different living things in each habitat from their own experience or from images.
The student can illustrate how the habitats are different by the different living things they support.
The student can show patterns of diversity by comparing the kinds of plants and animals found in each habitat.
